newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- March 26.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- March 26.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Wednesday:
* The Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the first time in over two years, boosting a key short-term rate by a quarter of a percentage point to 5.5 percent.

* The Fed Reserve's quarter-point interest rate increase will likely cause less disruption than last time in markets as Wall Street takes the view the economy, stock and bond markets can survive this credit tightening without major damage.
* Chinese Prime Minister Li Peng raised the issue with visiting U.S. Vice President Al Gore about a Justice Department investigation into alleged Chinese influence-peddling during the 1996 elections.
* Two U.S. Senators hit the road with a campaign to change the controversial U.S. system of financing political races.

* The National Transportation Safety Board said a New Jersey train engineer who ran a red signal and caused a collision in which he and two others were killed was going blind from diabetes but kept his condition secret.
* Lobbyists for various health tests are fighting to get government backing and Medicare support.
* Colombian paramilitaries are terrorising the country as they wage war against the country's rebel groups.
